availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis M. Ramsey (Signed a petition in Webster County, Kentucky, on behalf of William H. Winstead, c.1861.)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Daniel Ramsey and Frances Ramsey. Married to Catherine Ramsey. Father of John D. Ramsey and Sibba Ramsey. Resident of Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Webster County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District No. 2, p. 126A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 622.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District No. 4, p. 228B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Webster County, KY, June 1863, p. 43.
"F.M. Ramsey Called Away," The Spiro Tribune (Spiro, Oklahoma), March 22, 1917, p. 1.
